name: Ischemic Vascular Disease (IVD): Blood Pressure Management
description: The percentage of patients 18 years of age and older who were discharged alive for acute myocardial infarction (AMI), coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) or percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty (PTCA) from January 1- November 1 of the year prior to the measurement year, or who had a diagnosis of ischemic vascular disease (IVD) during the measurement year and the year prior to the measurement year and whose most recent blood pressure is in control (<140/90 mmHg).

or.title: PTCA performed 14 to 24 months before the measurement end date

and.title: Acute inpatient encounter 14 to 24 months before the measurement end date
Acute myocardial infarction active during acute inpatient encounter
Acute inpatient encounter 14 to 24 months before the measurement end date
CABG procedure performed 14 to 24 months before the measurement end date
Acute inpatient and outpatient encounter <=2 years, inclusive, before the measurement end date
Ischemic vascular disease active during acute inpatient and outpatient encounter
Systolic blood pressure minimum < 140 mmHg during most recent encounter, acute inpatient and outpatient
Diastolic blood pressure minimum < 90 mmHg during most recent encounter, acute inpatient and outpatient
